info.description:
This is API documentation for [Conformal Prediction based Virtual Screening](https://github.com/laeeq80/spark-cpvs-vina). The API is responsible for three web services i.e. providing ready-made prediction profiles for compounds, real-time docking for small number of molecules and a predictive on-demand docking service for large-scale compound profile generation (last one not ready yet). 

A profile contains ligand id, its prediction and docking score (if available) against multiple receptors.
info.title: Virtual Screening With Conformal Prediction

get.summary: Get a list of available receptor models
get.description: Gives a list of receptor models available in the database. This is useful if the user is unsure which models are available in the database.

get.summary: Get a sample of available ligands
get.description: Gives a sample (not random) of ligands available in the database. This is useful if the user wants to test API and unsure which ligands are available in the database.

get.summary: Get ligand predictive profile by id
get.description: Takes in ligand id and returns its profile including id, score, prediction, receptor(s) name and receptor(s) PDB code. The operation downloads new molecule from zinc and predict it agianst ready made models

parameters.name: lid
parameters.description: Ligand id that need to be considered for profiling

post.summary: Make predictions for a new ligand
post.description: Takes in ligand id, receptor name and receptor pdb Code and make prediction against the selected receptor model and save the prediction. This is useful if ligand prediction is not already available in the database.

parameters.name: lid
parameters.description: Ligand id that need to be considered for profiling

parameters.name: rName
parameters.description: Receptor Name relevant to model against which profiling needed to be perfomed

parameters.name: rPdbCode
parameters.description: Receptor PDB code relevant to model against which profiling needed to be perfomed

post.description: Takes in ligand id, receptor name and receptor pdb Code and docks ligand against the selected receptor and save the score. This is useful if the docking score is not already available in the database.
